CONJUGATES: n. friends | v. friends | friending | friended
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'frēond' (noun), meaning 'lover, relative, companion', from Proto-Germanic '*frijōndz' (present participle of '*frijōnan' 'to love'), from PIE root '*pri-' 'to love'. The verb usage is much more recent, particularly with social media.
SINCE: Before 900 AD (noun), early 2000s (verb, social media context)

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, typically exclusive of sexual or family relations.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与某人有相互喜爱关系的人，通常不包括性关系或家庭关系。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She is my best friend and we've known each other for years.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她是我最好的朋友，我们认识很多年了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who supports a cause, group, or person.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 支持某个事业、团体或人物的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He has always been a great friend of the arts and contributes generously.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他一直是艺术界的大力支持者，慷慨捐助。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that requires one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To add (someone) to a list of contacts on a social networking website.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在社交网站上将某人添加到联系人列表。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I'll friend you on Facebook so we can keep in touch.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我会在Facebook上加你好友，这样我们就能保持联系了。
